title: Peru 2022
text:
Different species of monkeys having a healthy lunch at the La Isla de Los Monos monkey rescue center in the Peruvian Amazon.


Gratitude for the beautiful view of Machu Picchu after a long hike.


And finally, the most incredible view from the train back to Cuzco from Machu Picchu.
(This photo had been my screen saver ever since I captured it!)

title: Costa Rica 2021
text:
Taken 2 miles away from our hotel, this picture encapsulates the tranquility and beauty of Costa Rica.


Our first night in Nosara, Costa Rica was blessed with the most incredible sunset. We knew from then on that we had fallen in love with this corner of the world.


And finally, the Costa Rican coast left us with an even more special sunset for our last night. Absolutely magical!

title: Veronique Letourneau
text: Welcome to my personal website I have created for my ENVS 193DS class at UCSB!

title: Veronique Letourneau
section: A little about me and my background:
text:
A little about me and my background:
My name is Veronique Letourneau and I like to go by V . I am a SBCC transfer student currently completing my fourth year in Environmental Studies at UCSB. As lucky as I am to be able to attend this University, I cannot wait to hop into the “real” world after graduation!

title: Veronique Letourneau
section: What you will find on my page
text:
What you will find on my page
I have tons of hobbies and interests apart from my field of study, but one thing I absolutely love in life is being able to travel and capture my experiences through photography. And there is no better feeling than sharing it others! So I welcome you to scroll through my tabs to see thru my lens :)

title: About my travels
text:
Throughout the years, I have had the absolute privilege to be able to make my way around areas of the globe with a few of the best people in my life.
Following my move to California, my two best friends an I made a pact to meet each other in a new country every year and we have certainly followed it to a T.
From getting our Scuba certification in Belize in 2019, to hiking Machu Picchu last summer, we have have been able to explore and discover 7 different countries together before even turning 21!

So I am sharing some of my favorite memories I have captured throughout the years for two of my Top 3 trips!
Welcome, Enjoy and I hope this ignites the travel bug in you!

title: Questions-Answers
text:
Link to GitHub Repo: https://github.com/veronique-let/choyoa-2_mysite
Webpage URL: https://veronique-let.github.io/choyoa-2_mysite/

Problem 1.

I highlighted some of my favorite pictures taken from two of my trips, with a home page introducing myself and the about page describing my travels and motivation to share. I went with my 2020 Costa Rica trip and Peru 2023.



My Experience.
8-10 sentences summarizing your experience, addressing (for example): What was hard about this? What was easy? What was new to you? What was familiar to you?
I absolutely loved doing this project! It was hard at first to figure out exactly how to link the repo to a webpage, but once I had gotten that figured out, the ball was rolling! Everything about this assignment was new to me but in such an exciting way! I am honestly hoping to get to learn more about GitHub pages, this was an interesting thing to do. A major factor for my enthusiasm in doing this project was being able to look back at my travel photos and share with you! I am very proud of how it came out and have received very nice feedback from people around me finding it quite impressive! So fun:)
